objenome.solver.evolve.grammar

Class GrammarRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.solver.evolve.grammar.GrammarRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, GrammarNode

    public class GrammarRule
extends java.lang.Object
implements GrammarNode, java.lang.Cloneable
    A GrammarRule is a component of a grammar parse tree that matches a rule of a BNF language grammar. Each rule should have one or more productions which are the possible valid mappings that this rule may resolve to.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GrammarRule()
      Constructs a GrammarRule with no specified name and an empty list of GrammarProductions.

      Constructs a GrammarRule with the specified name label and an empty list of GrammarProductions.
      GrammarRule(java.lang.String name, java.util.List<GrammarProduction> productions)
      Constructs a GrammarRule with the specified name label and the production choices.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GrammarRule

        public GrammarRule(java.lang.String name,
                   java.util.List<GrammarProduction> productions)
        Constructs a GrammarRule with the specified name label and the production choices.
        Parameters:
        name - the label that identifies this non-terminal rule.
        productions - a list of all the GrammarProductions that are possible mappings for this rule.

      • GrammarRule

        public GrammarRule(java.lang.String name)
        Constructs a GrammarRule with the specified name label and an empty list of GrammarProductions. Productions can be added after construction using the addProduction method.
        Parameters:
        name - the label that identifies this non-terminal rule.

      • GrammarRule

        public GrammarRule()
        Constructs a GrammarRule with no specified name and an empty list of GrammarProductions.

    • Method Detail

      • addProduction

        public void addProduction(GrammarProduction production)
        Append the given production to the list of GrammarProduction options.
        Parameters:
        production - the GrammarProduction instance to be appended to this rule's list of productions.

      • addProduction

        public void addProduction(int index,
                          GrammarProduction production)
        Inserts the given production at the specified position in the list of this rule's productions. The production currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent productions will be shifted to the right.
        Parameters:
        index - the position at which the specified production is to be inserted.
        production - the GrammarProduction instance to be inserted.

      • setProduction

        public void setProduction(int index,
                          GrammarProduction production)
        Replaces the GrammarProduction at the specified position in the list of this rule's productions.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the GrammarProduction to replace.
        production - the GrammarProduction instance to be stored at the specified position.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this rule, without the angle brackets.
        Returns:
        the name that references this rule.

      • isRecursive

        public boolean isRecursive()
        Returns whether this grammar rule refers to itself directly or indirectly.

        A rule is defined as recursive if any of the following are true:

        • The right hand side of the production rule contains the non-terminal on the left hand side.
        • The right hand side of the rule contains a non-terminal which points to a rule that is recursive due to any of the other two reasons.
        • The right hand side of the rule may contain a non-terminal that leads back to the same production rule.
        Returns:
        true if this grammar rule is recursive, false otherwise.

      • setRecursive

        public void setRecursive(boolean recursive)
        Specifies whether this rule recursively refers to itself either directly or indirectly.
        Parameters:
        recursive - whether this grammar rule recursively refers to itself.

      • getMinDepth

        public int getMinDepth()
        Gets the minimum depth required to resolve this rule fully to literals.
        Returns:
        the minimum depth required to resolve to terminal symbols.

      • setMinDepth

        public void setMinDepth(int minDepth)
        Sets the minimum depth required for this rule to resolve fully to all literals.
        Parameters:
        minDepth - the minimum depth required to get to all terminals.
